dialogues.text: Welcome to the Artisans' workshop, traveler.
My name is Duncan! I'm the head craftsman and owner of this workshop. If you need any help creating or building things, I'm your guy!
In this workshop we focus on building and creating things! In short, we focus on the art of Crafting!
I heard good things about you from Douglas. He's my apprentice! How would you like to learn some new skills?
I can teach you the basics of Crafting if you'd like?

options.text: Please teach me how Crafting works!

dialogues.text: That's the spirit! Now, before we get started. Let's get some basics down.
First, in order to create items, we will need resources. The number can range from 1 to 4 resources and we call the combination a 'recipe'.
Whether you can create an item will depend on two things: You must have the required Crafting level to create the item, and you must know the recipe.
Some common recipes will be readily available to you, whereas better and often rarer recipes can be unlocked in a variety of ways. You should explore and discover these yourself.
You may use Crafting Stations to create your desired item. There are two in this building, but you can find them in most towns or cities in Myrinnia.
That's it. Would you like me to repeat this, or are you ready to get to work?

options.text: I understand. I'm ready to get started!
Can we go over it once more?

dialogues.text: Alright, we will need resources first. 5 Azurite Ore and 2 Logs should do.

options.text: Where can I get Azurite Ore?

dialogues.text: Azurite ore can be mined in Mt. Azure. Go directly north from Port Azure to Lake Azure, where you will find the entrance to the mountain caves.
You will find some trees in Sunrise Sands, but also around Lake Azure.
Great! I see you managed to get the required materials. Now, we still haven't discussed what we're going to make. That's because I will provide you with the recipes now.
You may choose to create either a sword, a bow or a staff. Please proceed to the Crafting Station and create the item of your choice.
Excellent work! You'll be a great craftsman in no time! Keep your weapon as a reward!
I suppose now your work here is done. You should ask Mayor Wilson what to do next.
